options.content:
## Node Rewards Dashboard Investigation Guide

When investigating a reward period, use the **Grafana Date Picker** to select the precise date range that *fully covers* the reward window.

### Why This Is Important  
Reward metrics are stored at **00:00:00 UTC**, meaning:

- Using relative ranges like `Last X days` may **exclude the first day** of the period.
- Always double-check your selected range when reviewing a current or past reward period.

### Exporting Reward Data  
- To export data in CSV format, you can use the **DRE tool**, available here:  
  https://github.com/dfinity/dre/latest
- Instructions on how to use the tool:  
  https://dfinity.github.io/dre/node-rewards.html?h=node+rewa

### What this dashboard shows
- How rewards are affected over a selected date range.
- Which node/nodes concurred to possible rewards reductions over the date range.

### How to investigate

#### Example: 2025‑11 distribution
1. Open the date picker and set From = 2025‑10‑14, To = 2025‑11‑12.
2. Pick the Node Provider of interest.
3. For an Node Provider:
   - Check `Base vs Adjusted rewards over time` and `Provider rewards penalty` to see when the gap opens.
   - Open `Performance multiplier` to see which nodes drove the drop.
   - Correlate with `Original failure rate` and `Relative failure rate`.
     - If relative ≈ original, it’s node‑specific issue.
     - If relative ≈ 0 while original is high, the subnet likely had issues. Rewards won't be impacted.
   - Validate with `Subnet failure rates over time`.

#### Example:“Current distribution
1. In the date picker, set:
   - **From** = the date shown in `Current Reward Period Start`.
   - **To** = today.
2. Repeat the analysis steps above to identify current drivers.

panels.description: (1 - Total Adjusted Rewards / Total Base Rewards) * 100
panels.title: Total Reward Reduction

panels.description: Heatmap showing distribution of original failure rates across all nodes
panels.title: Original Failure Rate Heatmap

panels.description:
Heatmap showing distribution of relative failure rates across all nodes.
relative failure rate = original failure rate - subnet failure rate
panels.title: Relative Failure Rate > 10%
